component.name: Switchyard
component.summary: Rules-based URL router that replaces your default web browser

description.p: Switchyard is a URL router for Linux that makes sure clicked links get sent to the right browser based on your rules. Like a railroad switchyard directing trains to different tracks, it routes URLs to the appropriate browser, or lets you choose with a quick prompt when no rule matches.

ul.li: Rule-based routing: Automatically send URLs to specific browsers based on powerful text patterns
Multi-condition rules: Stack multiple conditions with AND/OR logic for precise routing
Multiple pattern types: Exact domain, URL contains, wildcard (glob), and regex
Quick prompt with keyboard shortcuts (press 1-9 to instantly select a browser)
Daemonless: Runs only when needed, no background processes
Simple TOML configuration file for power users
Rules-based URL routing with multiple pattern types (domain, keyword, glob, regex)
Quick browser prompt with libadwaita UI
